titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, some of the text at the top of f. 41 is tricky to read due a hole which has obscured some of the text in this area.

mods.abstract: The letter is forwarding a copy of his reply to Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mirzā the Prince at Sheraz [Shiraz] and his Prime Minister Nasser Allah Khan. Includes one enclosure:1. Translation of a letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith to the Prince at Sheraz, dated 18 September 1807. The Resident is sending his gratitude for the honours and gifts recently bestowed upon him by the Prince. He further expresses a wish that, as the Prince's ambassador Mohumed Nebee Khan [Muḥammad Nabī Khān] is proceeding towards Tahran [Tehran], he make efforts to improve relations between Britain and Persia.
